intro: Pucara leucantha, commonly known as the white pucara, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are usually broad and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Pucara leucantha is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its potential medicinal properties.
